title: Worst of 5 other tablets I own.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 27, 2023
text: Have 5 other tablets, 4 of which have worked fine for many years.  My "cheap" ten inch recently began to act up so I thought I would pay the extra this time for a Samsung since they are supposed to be so good.  BIG MISTAKE!  Seems to operate (or really... not operate) differently with every update.  One problem after another.  Today USB no longer connects to PC for file transfer and nothing seems to fix the situation.  You might note that I have a EET and BS degree in Electronics Engineering and Computer Science with close to 40 years of experience so I am well able to correctly follow instructions online of the (VERY MANY) suggested ways of "fixing" these problems on this device.  Maybe next "update" will fix it?  Buy one of these if you want to continuously fight one stupid problem after another and just use the tablet for whatever Samsung decides you need to do today instead of what you would like to do.  I agree with  other reviews on the Samsung "App Bloat" on the device.  You are forced to have WAY too many Samsung apps that you probably will never want and/or need.  That would not be as bad if you were not continuously punished in one way or another for having them.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Disappointed in bluetooth audio malfunction, no full charge
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2022
text: I had high hopes for this tablet, switching from a Kindle Fire which wouldn't run some apps I wanted. However, after a few months I've decided I'm disappointed. First, I just recently tried to pair two different sets and brands of bluetooth earbuds. In both cases I experienced the same issue: sound only came through one earbud and somewhat erratically, not always the same side. The earbuds work fine when paired with other devices (like my old Fire or a laptop), so it's not the earbuds. In any case I tried all the troubleshooting, repairing, etc. recommended for the earbuds. So there is something off in the bluetooth audio function in the tablet. Secondly, I regularly get a reading of less than 100% charge (something in the 90s) after many hours of charging. Checking on this issue, I did a complete battery drain to "reset" the meter, but after a couple charges it went back to not reaching 100% again. I also miss from the Fire a simple bluescreen filter toggle for reading before bed. The Samsung has a night brightness reduction but with set times which can't even be changed. There don't seem to be a lot of quality tablet options in this price range, so I'm really sad this hasn't worked out so well. The Fire did better in all the areas mentioned here for far less money. I would buy a new Fire if its Android implementation wasn't hamstrung. So I guess I'm stuck.

title: Makes a big cellphone!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 15, 2022
text: I bought this tablet to replace my 8-10 year old 10.1 inch Samsung tablet. I have some software I use on my cellphone that I can also use on a tablet(just that my tablet makes the software much more user friendly). product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Android 12 update caused major problem
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2022
text: After receiving delivery, I enjoyed the screen quality of my new tablet. I got used to the high resolution, it was great for watching a movie. I usually had earbuds for sound as I used it primarily as a bedtime device and I did not want to disturb my wife. After about a month of ownership, I turned on the tablet to find that Android 12 had to be installed to further use the product. After installation of Android 12, the tablet developed a strange problem. When I turned it on after off for the night, there was no sound. I restarted the tablet and was relieved to find the sound returned. Each time off for the night, next day no sound. It always required a time consuming restart. I finally contacted Samsung support. After two techs and a lot of time to try and resolve the problem, NO improvement. By this time I had spent at least six hours wasted with NO improvement. Finally Samsung said to mail it to New Jersey for repair. Today they emailed me my tablet is to be returned unrepaired. The Samsung representative claims the tablet had been damaged by water which voids the warranty. TOTAL BS. At this time I would like to advise anyone thinking of buying a Samsung product, to think twice.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Works but....
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2022
text: I have been having non stop GPS location issues. Not sure if I got a bad item but my tablet cannot find my location nor able to use gps within my car. Compared to my Samsung A32 5G the audio codecs are terrible compared to my phone. Using the headphone jack on my phone produces clearer and more pronounced sounds. I am using this tablet as a auto radio headunit. It works great for the most part. I am still waiting on a unlock method so I can root it but otherwise I am unsure if I would recommend this tablet as it feels outdated esp compared to the A7 tablet which is almost identical (LESS RAM). Also this tablet has an atrocious time connecting via bluetooth. I cannot connect my phone to my tablet and they are both Samsung supported products. I also have tried using apple products and the same can be said. For these major reasons I would not suggest this device to anyone who depend on GPS and Bluetooth connectivity.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Shockingly bad wireless reception *UPDATE*
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2022
text: Got this to replace my 6 year old Kindle Fire only to discover rather quickly that you must be in direct line of sight of your wifi router to get any reception at all. Any door or wall will drop the signal so low you can't stream anything and will eventually just disconnect itself despite being only a few feet from the router. Total garbage. My phone and all other wifi devices have excellent signal anywhere in the house, even outside. Not this trash though.How does this have such good reviews when my very much older device is 100 times better at the only thing that matters?Total waste of money.*UPDATE*After about 7 months of use I would like to update my original review by asking Amazon for something lower than 1 star. Zero stars? Negative stars?In addition to the abysmal wi-fi reception, it also seems that the battery life of this thing is also unacceptably horrible. In a turned off state the unit will lose about 25% battery life per day. That's right, TURNED OFF it loses battery life at an amazing rate. You would have to keep it permanently connected to power to be able to use it daily. I find myself using it less and less. So If I go a week without  using it I have to do a complete full charge to use it again (this takes several hours) so it's never ready when I need it.

And the 8 yr old iPad does as well. Return already processing.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: DO NOT BUY ON PRIME DAY
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2022
text: Bought the 128GB Tab A8 on Prime Day to save $40, but it arrived DOA. The tablet makes a little beep when the charger is attached, but the screen never turns on. Tried the volume down and power button method a few different times and it just won't work. Also tried my Samsung phone charger in case the charger that came with the tablet was defective, and that made no difference.My order says this item is eligible for a refund or replacement, but product support told me that I can't have a replacement. They said they only have an option for a refund of the Prime Day price and I would have to purchase a new tablet at the current price. The rep then offered to send me to another department that could refund the current tablet price. That department never answered after almost 15 minutes. The product support rep then said she'd send them an email and I should expect a call from that department within 24 hours.Literally two minutes after the call ended, I received an email that says Amazon doesn't price match and they hope this resolved my question. Nope, not at all. I'll call back to get a refund, but this is definitely not a deal if I have to send it back and spend more money elsewhere for a tablet to go with the SD card and case that I also bought through Amazon on Prime Day. Be careful buying during these deal days, they're not honoring the replacement.

I thought I could live with it but, nope. I returned it two weeks ago, still waiting on a refund... Amazon! I opted  for a refurbished S6, so much better. If you insist on a great screen, go Amoled.

title: Samsung Customer Service is Worthless
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 29, 2022
text: Two months in, it stopped charging. I called in to try to get it set up for repair locally, bu their system was down so they couldn't set it up, but they could give me a ticket number. I mailed it on my dime using the ticket number. They then claimed it had a dent and warranty was void. I called in to tell them it had no dent when I sent it, and they said they would repair it free of charge. However, the person I spoke to didn't put any notes on the ticket, and they just canceled the ticket for no response and sent it back to me unrepaired. When I called again, they said if there were no notes, the conversation didn't happen. Thank you Samsung!Edit: forgot to mention that I sent in charger and cable, because they said to send those when you send in for charging issues. They conveniently forgot to send those back.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Malfunctions from the start
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 7, 2022
text: While trying to set the tablet up it began spontaneously returning to the home screen at random times. At first I thought I must be touching the navigation buttons but I was able to rule that out because the problem occurred even when the tablet was laying flat on the table with nothing even close to the navigation buttons. I couldn't even set up my email initially it happened so often. I contacted Amazon customer support, and they had me try all the things I had already tried to no avail. But at least it began to happen less frequently. I should have returned it the first day, but the problem became more intermittent. It still happened multiple times every single time I used it, but less often so I was able to complete tasks. Nobody wants to return a device they've put all their personal information on, so I continued to be patient. One month in, and I took it off the charger one morning, checked the weather without issues, and 5 minutes later it was just a brick. Completely unresponsive. I tried a factory reset from the off position without luck. Ruled out charger issues. Thankfully Amazon refunded my money and took it back. I am sure every tablet isn't as defective as the one I was sent, but that is the one I am reviewing. I declined having them send me another of the same tablet, and I bought a Lenovo instead.

text: UPDATE:  I searched this online and found a YouTube video that addresses this as apparently it is a common problem.  I was able to reset the tablet by holding down only the power and volume down keys.  I had tried holding down the power and both volume up and down keys, but that did not work.  Anyway, the video with the two keys did work!!I've put in a warranty request and have to file an official claim on Monday by calling their 800#, but The exterior buttons that control the power on/off, volume and battery charger all stopped working.  I thought maybe I someonw hit a lock, but my boyfriend who works in IT was also not able to fix it.  I've only had it three months and just used it to watch some shows and check email and FB/IG.If anyone knows how to fix this problem where it won't process anything that you are touching except the touch screen when it does come on, please share the fix.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Don't buy this product from Amazon
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2022
text: I purchased these as a gift for my kids. The boxes appeared normal but upon opening them it was clear something was not right with the product itself. The tablets included an adapter plug (a bent one at that) to allow you to plug into US outlets. It was clearly made for another part of the world. This was further proven when the welcome prompts didn't even include the US as a country of residence to choose from. I tried to return these and Amazon still hasn't refunded me for one of them. I've spent hours of my life on hold, being tossed around, and then finally told to call back later. I have never been disappointed in Amazon until now. Save yourself all this hassle and go straight to the source for these tablets. We love the actual (made for the US) tablets and have used them for years - but you're not going to receive that if you order it here.

text: I wish that I had researched the Galaxy A8 before buying it. Apparently they're known for having Wi-Fi connectivity issues. Essentially anytime my tablet or wifi gets turned off or has to restart it disconnects from the Wi-Fi and then it won't reconnect without going through a whole bunch of steps. Finally I gave up and I am returning this item because it refuses to connect to my internet and I've never had this issue before. I spent an hour on the phone with Samsung and they told me to return it. I mean geez you think that they would have to figure this out at this point with how many years they've been putting tablets out. Whatever ridiculous thing to have happen on such an expensive item

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Unreliable and/or underpowered, drains battery while idle
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2023
text: Basically, I am using a tablet as a Zwift appliance for my smart exercise bike.  Switched from an old iPad because Apple's billing kept cancelling the subscription.  The A8 is noticeably slower driving the UI, paring bluetooth devices and generally doing everything.  But it runs the Zwift app with its 3D rendering just fine. And that was all I wanted until I tried to run Skoove (piano lessons), and the app just crashes constantly.  Skoove runs fine on my Pixel phone, and while these things are hard to diagnose for sure, the symptoms suggest that the device is either fundamentally unreliable, or unsuitable for a "real" app.  I've also found that the idle battery life is only about two days, which is pretty bad considering I have almost nothing installed.Spend more money and buy something better!

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: 3GB RAM model is almost useless
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 12, 2022
text: The 3 GB RAM model struggles to run ANY application,  and switching between two running apps takes like a minute, if it doesn't crash while trying. Extremely disappointed. Avoid it.Screen is okay. Colors are noticeably flatter than higher end tablets, but its got okay viewing angles, gets pretty bright, and is pretty responsive (only when it's actually managing to run an app smoothly, however)Battery life is pretty good. Camera isn't really all that great, but useable. The build quality feels quite nice, however.Also, for some reason I received an overseas model? It wouldn't let me select the USA as my country during setup, and came with an overseas charger brick.All in all, while thw rest of the device is okay, the performance (or lack therof) makes the 3GB NOT worth the money, in fact the 3GB model should be discontinued in my opinion, as it seems unable to run almost anything other than the most basic applications, and still struggles on them. I do not know if the 4GB model fixes these problems, but if it does, I would recommend it

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Great Price, But not good for even the basic use
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 17, 2022
text: Feel bad leaving such a low rating since I bought it for only 179$ (While the cheapest Ipad is around 1,000$). I only use the tablet to stream when I'm flying, very basic, and it doesn't even do that well. It keeps crashing on me when I'm trying to load some apps again, then it's a hustle to get it back since there are no buttons and the screen freeze. It's very slow...I mean even rotating the screen on its side takes 3 seconds until something happens. The battery drains super fast and takes forever to charge it. Overall doesn't worth it even for the low price. I'm surprised Samsung released that product since users won't buy the better model after a nightmare experience with the basic model...Most important warning - the 32GB internal storage is already loaded with unerasable apps and software that takes 15GB already. The tablet keeps updating and that storage runout even if you don't touch the tablet. So that's a bit deceiving on their part to advertise that as 32GB for the user use...I bought a 256 GB SD card added to it. Only one problem - Most apps don't let you use external storage. so if you download HBO series to the tablet you need to rely on the internal storage.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Defective WIFI
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2023
text: Whatever to like it, as I have a Galaxy phone but soon realized that there was an issue with WIFI: Loses connection intermittently, has very low speed and even forgets the WIFI password. It mostly happens when connected to 5MHz networks. Technician will blame the router and then will suggest to reboot but it is clear that the problem is the tablet.  After noting the issue, did some research and find out that it is a known issue but has not been resolved by Samsung.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Terrible. Screen issues from the beginning
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2022
text: From the beginning I had issues with the touch-screen being unresponsive. It was initially manageable, but then a couple of months later the touch-screen suddenly became completely unresponsive with a lot of flickering. As it was still under warranty, I shipped it to Samsung for a replacement. They had it for a couple of weeks and sent it back unrepaired. Amazon then gave me a refund. I tried purchasing another Samsung A8 during thanksgiving. Added it to my cart... and as I was about to pay today I noticed that as a CYBER MONDAY DEAL the price has increased by $60. THE PRICE WENT UP BY $60 AS A CYBER MONDAY DEAL!!! Unbelievable. What a joke! I'd get another tablet but now I am stuck with the keyboard  with cover/case that I purchased with the original A8 a couple of months ago.

title: NOT MADE FOR U.S. MARKET!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2022
text: Really disappointed in Amazon customer service.  When I tried to set up the device, I chose English (US) as language and then on the "choose country or region" there is no choice for US (or Canada, or Australia etc).  In chat with customer service, I asked if this device was made for US market and got a bunch of lies in response such as "most consumers are choosing UK" for region, and the A8 is brand new on the market, and the device is made for "general world wide", and also that "there is a US version but it does not work in countries like Europe"  (since when is Europe a country??).  I'm returning it.  I will not buy another Samsung device from Amazon.  It should be clearly stated in their product description that this is not made for US market.  I have lost a lot of faith in Amazon's representation of products and their customer service.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Wifi issue
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2022
text: Terribly disappointed in Samsung. Just took delivery of an A8 10.5" with 128GB and discovered that the 5GHz wifi will not stay connected more than a few seconds if my network is not connected to the internet. 2.4GHz works as expected, but doesn't play well with bluetooth. I also have a Samsung A11 phone and a Samsung Tab A 8", both of which work on 5GHz as expected.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Can't save apps to SD Card
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2022
text: This is just a warning to anyone thinking of picking this up. The 32GB option seemed very affordable and with the advertised "expandable storage", I figured I could pick up a MicroSD card have more space for my mobile games.Turns out that you're not able to move apps to your SD card in most cases. You're given the option to move to External Storage in the app settings, but it doesn't work. Maybe some data will move over, but the bulk of it will remain in Internal Storage. Needless to say, my 32GB quickly filled to capacity. There's so much bloatware that you basically have like 18GB left of space after starting everything up.If you're stubborn and NEED to get this tablet, go for the one with the biggest storage. I heard there's some conspiracy to phase out expandable storage, but I honestly don't know why this is a thing.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Okay for an Android Tablet
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2022
text: All I can say is wow. If this is device is indicative of how Android tablets perform, then it is no wonder Apple dominates the segment. This brand new, shiny tablet performs about as well as the bottom of the line iPad - from about 5 years ago. It is dismal. If you really need to have an Android device, it passable. But compared the iPad, it is an overpriced joke. Slower performance, fewer optimized applications, Samsung bloatware, atrocious camera. And you don't really save any money over the base model iPad. Maybe there are some competitive Android tablets out there. This isn't one of them.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Useless UNSTABLE WIFI
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2022
text: I had two of these, both of which I returned!  With the first one I had to try 6 times to complete SmartSwitch over wifi.  As I used it , the wifi connection kept randomly dropping, cutting off my Internet connection!  I thought it was an isolated defective item.  I ordered a replacement which I couldn't get to complete SmartSwitch at all.  I spent hours with hapless Samsung tech support, and finally I sat right next to the wireless router and managed to complete SmartSwitch. Unfortunately the fundamental problem was that the wireless function's instability was why SmartSwitch wasn't working well and that problem remained.  This tablet has a USELESS DYSFUNCTIONAL WIFI!!  It disconnects and needs to be reconnected every 5-10 minutes, making anything depending on an Internet connection impossible!!  I thought a wifi booster would solve the problem but NO!  THIS TABLET IS USELESS if you need any wifi/Internet service!

I have returned The Tablet to Factory setting.

text: I have had a samsung tablet for many years and it has worked well.  When I needed a new one that is what I chose.  I recently bought a samsung A8 through Amazon. So I went through the process.  Return authorization, refund processing still happening, dropped it off at Kohls.  anybody can have a bad product, so I tried again.  Amazon's delivery was great.  Opened the box and started the setup.  This one has a purple line right down the middle of the screen.  Restarting does not help.  Two out of two is pretty bad.  That makes me look like a bad customer when it is not my fault.

text: I like this device, and would love to give it a 5-star review. But it can't get wifi reception in my bedroom. No other devices (laptop, desktop, phone, multiple other tablets including an iPad and a cheap Fire tablet, and a security camera) have any problem connecting. I've tried factory resets and connection resets, and I've tried connecting to both 5ghz and 2.4ghz channels -  it all works great when I'm near the router, and not at all when I'm a room away.I don't think the tablet I received is defective, because it works great at long as I'm closer to the router. I just think the wifi antenna inside this thing is garbage.Sadly, I didn't realize this issue existed until I'd had the tablet  for a while, so I can't return it. I wouldn't consider buying another Samsung product, though.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: A better tablet than what I was looking for
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2023
text: I've been looking at getting a new inexpensive 10" tablet for awhile now. Didn't need anything special as I was just planning on using it to replace an old HP Touchpad (WebOS) tablet that I've been using as a dedicated tablet for some PDF technical manuals & books - along with photos and videos. The HP tablet has lasted many a year - but it was starting to fall apart and the battery had developed issues.This Samsung tablet looked interesting - and it was on sale - for a little more than any of the cheap no-name tablets I had been considering. I have had a Samsung Tab tablet before - years ago - and it was a decent tablet. So I knew this one would be of fairly good quality - with the cheaper tablets I had no clue what I might get.The tablet is nice - very thin - but surprising heavy. I like that I can add a micro SD memory card to it - which I will be doing to simplify the storage of the material that I want to use on the tablet.Setting up this new tablet took some time. Right out of the box it needed to be updated - and most of the apps needed updating. So I had to connect it to the internet, and log into my Google account to do some of that. Then I had to set up a Samsung account to update those apps. Which was easy to do as you can use your Google account to create the Samsung account. There is some two-step verification that has to be done - so you do have to use your cell phone number to get the code. The process was a bit more involved than I would have liked - but that is pretty much how most things work these days. You also have to deal with setting a ton of permissions - most of which I turned Off.Once I got everything updated, I played with the tablet for a bit. I was surprised to see some Microsoft apps on it - and it has the option of using OneDrive (which I refuse to do). I'll probably uninstall those apps.Really all I needed was a basic android tablet - that could play videos, view photos, and open PDFs. This tablet is capable of much more than that. I'm more than happy with my purchase.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Excellent all round tablet
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2022
text: I currently have a Samsung Galaxy Tab A T580 (2016) and an iPad 9th gen (2016) the later of which is being used by my wife. Being 6 years old, my other tablets were becoming a bit slow although resetting the T580 to factory defaults and then reinstalling the apps significantly sped up this older tablet. I primarily use the tablet to watch videos (Netflix, Pluto, etc.) and do research via a browser. Although I didn't really need a new tablet, special circumstances enabled me to get this tablet new for < $180 (sales tax holiday also) which was a deal that I couldn't pass up.Keep in mind that whenever you switch to a new device there will be subtle differences that will take some time to get used to.The picture on this tablet is excellent with good color rendition. The color tone is a little less warm (less reddish) than the iPad or T580 but is excellent and now that I have gotten used to it, I prefer the color rendition on this tablet.  If after you load the tablet and don't like the color or picture, I'd suggest going to settings/display and then;1) Turn brightness up to just a little to the left of the red part of the line2) Turn adaptive brightness off3) Turn eye comfort shield off. Note that if you tap the text "Eye Comfort Shield" you are taken to a 2nd screen where you can adjust the color temperature. Like the color temp in a light bulb it will change the color tone from more white to yellowish.Unlike the iPad and T580, this tablet does not have a physical home button which took me a couple of hours to get used to. Although I would prefer a physical home button the soft button (swipe up a little and then select the rectangle) works fine.I should note that I used the data transfer tool to copy all of my data, settings and apps from the T580 to the new tablet. There were a few minor issues but the transfer completed. However, the color on the Tab A was off - a bit to the yellow, white skin was gray, shadows had a green/yellow tint, no true white and I couldn't find a setting to correct this. At first I assumed there was a defect in the tablet. However, I reset to factory defaults and then manually reloaded and now everything is fine.I think that the wallpaper options on this tablet are terrible. You can install an app that can be used to download other wallpapers but who wants another app. I just went outside and took a pic of the blue sky with clouds and use this as my wallpaper which I really like.Older Android versions had some options that are missing from this tablet that I miss such as the ability to make the app icons larger and 'icons with frames'.When doing a fresh install versus transferring data from an old device it gives you the option to not install some apps which saves time from having to find & delete later.Note that this tablet uses a USB-C connector on the tablet side which is the newest standard but uses the standard USB A rectangular connector on the charger side. Like me, your home charging station is probably becoming more crowded with a Micro USB, USB-C, Fitbit and lightning cables. You can buy adapters on eBay for a buck or 2 if you want to reduce the number of cables.I am not an anti-Apple person. I use an iPhone 13 but find the iPads to be too expensive and the user interface to be clunky and difficult to use compared to the Android tablet options.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Samsung Tablet a8
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 24, 2022
text: I picked up this tablet to use on the kitchen table.  We have 5 other tablets.  All Samsung.  It connects to everything just fine including a Logitech k480 keyboard which is like a fully blown keyboard and size.  I have taken it way out in the yard and across the street and it pulls in the Wi-Fi just fine.  I read all the bad reviews and I think that 90% of them are user are.  It expands just fine on You tube but if you have slow wi-fi it might not have strong enough signal to expand.  I have Samsung TV's in every room in the house.  I am on an Antenna and get over 90 channels.  The farther down the line I get a weak signal and I had to put a booster on the line.  I have had the TV's and tablet go black but that is a bug not to product.  I have gotten around it all and no longer have the problem.  I leave the A8 on the kitchen table and we can use it at breakfast all week on one charge.  The battery is just fine.  It depends on how bright you have it set and how long a time on the automatic turn off set.  It has 4 speakers.  It has more, base than I like and when watching something on You Tube the sound can sound like it is coming from a tin can at times.  I like the sound of my Samsung s6 lite much better.  I have good hearing even though I am in my 70's.  I got it on a fantastic sale form Costco.  I bought my s6 light for $249.99 when someone on Amazon had a good sale and I use some of my reward points.  The A8 is a good tablet.  The 7 has better reviews but cost more.  It is a very good tablet for the money.  I have a lot of grand and great grandchildren and I have bought many brands of tablets.  Amazon Fire tablets were on a half price sale two years ago.  They turned out to be great.  For $80 they were an out of the park homerun.  I suggest if you are having problems return it for a new one or refund.  If you go over the time to return It is your fault.  No one makes a perfect product that works out of the box all the time.  Don't write a bad review if you are a dumb schmuck that can't make it work.  Check your settings and learn how to use it.  I am old and have no problem at all.  I just like Samsung products except for the Kitchen appliances.  They are over price and break down.  That is another story for another review.  NO I don't own any

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Great Product For Cost
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 22, 2022
text: NOTE: THIS IS FOR THE 64GB MODEL WHICH HAS MORE RAM/MEMORY THAN THE 32GB VERSION.I do NOT recommend the 32GB version, as any buffering/stutter that DOES occur is fine on the 64GB model, but WILL be an issue on the 32GB model.---To be clear, this tablet is a great value if you're looking for a tablet that feels premium, but on a budget.  One review states 'Best value for a tablet' and this is BS.  You can 100% get better value, but you may not have a screen that's as high quality, or a battery that lasts as long.BATTERY:On idle, the tablet lasts about 5-days, but using the tablet will drain faster (obviously).  I state idle time for those who like to keep the tablet on for periods of time unplugged (like myself) as letting it drain to 0% is very bad for the battery.  I watch maybe 30mins of videos at a time and it'll drain around 5-10% at mid brightness.  With prolonged use, that may decrease as extended use can generate heat and increase drain.  However, for my use I didn't notice any significant heat like on cheaper tablets.  USB-C is also used for charging, so this is great news for compatibility.SCREEN:Screen looks amazing for the price.  You may find better, but for less than $300 this is the one to pick up.  You get a 10.5in screen which is massive, and looks absolutely gorgeous.  I don't use a screen protector for mine, but do have a flip case to protect the screen between uses.SPEED:Overall the tablet seems perfect when watching YT/Crunchyroll streams.  I don't game on this tablet so can't speak on them.  For videos and general use, this device is perfect.  It did stutter one time and go black for a few seconds, but it was a bit of an anomaly that I didn't notice after.  The device will have a slight response time for some actions, but overall apps load reasonably and all videos buffer ahead as you'd hope.SOUND:Overall sound is good.  You will hear words clearly enough.  It's a basic speaker.  You won't be impressed, but you also won't be insulted (some of the cheaper tablets are so tinny, you can't even make out words!).  It does have a 3.5 AUX audio cable for wired sound devices, as well as BT capability.  I use BT without noticeable latency so that's nice!  Really it's got the basics you'll need and then some.CHARGING:First note, as above, is the tablet is USB-C.  This is great as all newer devices worth buying use USB-C (get on board iPhone!).  However this warranted it's own category as the charger/brick it comes with are not the best.  It is a standard charger that works fine for the device, and does standard charge rates.  However, I found using my Super Fast Charging cable/brick that came with my phone charged this tablet at 2x the speed (fast charging rates).The standard charger was reported by the tablet itself as 'Charging' speeds.  Ampere reported a charging rate of 1220mA - 1250mA.The super fast charger was reported by the tablet itself as 'Fast Charging' speeds (limit of the tablet).  Ampere reported a charging rate of 2540mA - 2560mA which is double the rate.The drain while running these reports WITHOUT charging was -460mA at approximately 1/3rd of the screen brightness.Also note the super fast charger (which charged at fast charging rates) did not heat up as much.  The standard charger that came with the tablet got fairly warm, but not uncomfortable hot.  It does the job just not as well.What this should tell you is that while the device can charge fine with the standard charger, you can upgrade to a Fast Charging capable charger for faster charging rates.  Note faster charging will cause the tablet to heat up more esp if charging while in use!  Faster charging can also reduce the life span of a tablet's battery capacity over time (over use of several years).  If being able to charge faster is important, I'd recommend a fast charger by a reputable brand such as Anker (there are plenty of others, so shop around and see which one you like most, just making sure it supports Fast Charging).OVERALL:In general it's a great tablet.  Like I stated it opens apps quickly enough and overall quality is there.  A $500+ tablet by Samsung, for example, will have overall better sound quality and performance.  However, $250-$300 on this tablet will get you a lot of performance with the Samsung quality you'd expect.  I also feel that while a $500-$800 tablet WILL be much better for gaming or prolonged use, it won't 'blow it out of the water.'  This device may not have the premium sound quality or instant feedback of a higher priced tablet, but it works VERY well for much less.  It's a very good intro into the high end line of Samsung tablets, AND a full 10.5in screen which is perfect for browsing or watching videos/streams.

text: This tablet was an Amazon gift from my friends.  It will not stay connected to my home wifi.  It has successfully connected 3 times thus far (within 3 days).  Each time the connection will immediately die within a few minutes & then refuse to accept my wifi password.  So I've already spent more time trying to connect to wifi than I have actually using tablet...I have consulted with both xFinity & Samsung tech reps to correct the issue.  (No success with either.)  Since all my other devices connect perfectly well to home wifi, the problem is clearly with the tablet itself.  Since reading other product reviews citing this same issue, it does appear that I am not alone...so goodbye tablet...back to Amazon you go!

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Meh... It's a 3 star for sure and should probably be in the $100 range.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 23, 2022
text: I got this tablet on prime day because I wanted one for years. I wasn't expecting much and have tons of experience with both Android and Samsung. That said, it's just gotta be different... why... I will be honest, even though I wasn't expecting much, I still feel this tablet is not worth the cost and quite frankly, feels dated and old right out of the box.Start-up went about as expect. Although, no charger included. Rude! Seriously though... what is with these guys not giving us chargers? It's been going on for so long at this point I am actually running out of options for cables and chargers. Trying to find ones compatible with each device is a pain in the ass. Does is super fast charge? Is it USB-C? Etc etc... Just give us a damn charger and cable.The tablet didn't want to connect to my S21 Ultra or my Pixel 3a XL to gather app data and account information. Finally forced it through direct connection after multiple restarts of both devices. No idea what caused the hiccup... it just kinda started working. Nothing was changed when it decided to work. You enable a couple options on both devices, sit back and let it do it's thing. 3rd time it decided to cooperate.Next issue was how slow it is. I chalked this up in the beginning to updates and such, but nope... still slow. I've cleared everything, removed unnecessary apps, optimized battery and background usage etc etc... This thing feels like a dated iPad from 2012. It's very unresponsive and laggy. It doesn't matter how much storage you have left, it's due to the small amount of RAM and slow CPU. My worst fears were a slow tablet because of these things.The final issue I have is the screen itself. The image quality to be more accurate. It's VERY blue. There is no "night" option like in literally every other device I have ever owned. Or as Samsung calls it, something along the lines of "eye care". No option for color tones at all on this device. Even after forced updates.SO, overall I believe it's a subpar tablet that Samsung just threw together with parts they had laying around to milk the most of excess junk they had - quite frankly. It should be in the $100 range, no more than $130. There is nothing $200+ about this tablet. If it was that price range, it would still be MAYBE a 3.5-4 star review.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: The best Android Tablet Yet
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 22, 2022
text: I am absolutely blown away by this tablet.  Long-time Android phone user - but never impressed by the tablets.  I have been using iPads for years because they are so well designed and have such a great screen - but this is a game-changer.  Paired with my Galaxy S21 - this is fantastic.  Cross-device sharing of files and apps - beautiful screen - incredibly fast - no lag on anything.  The pen is delightful to use but hard to keep up with. (one of the only negatives).  The size is also perfect - I think any other size would have been too large for my use case - I would just use a laptop for anything larger - but this is perfect for working on the go or surfing the web on the couch.  DEX mode is really cool too.I have the Samsung keyboard and it is pretty nice - I think it could benefit from lit keys - and I occasionally have a few keys that do not register when I type - but that may still be me learning how to type on a mini keyboard.  The KB has a great place to store the pen - which is nice.  OH - also having the fingerprint reader on the power button is another great feature!!!

text: I traded my Samsung Tab S2 for this newer tablet.  After 6 years the OS was getting left behind and apps eventually do not work on the old OS.  It wasn't love at first use.  The switch over is really easy with the supplied software.  There is a difference in the screen, but I understood that upfront and once I adjusted settings to my liking, I started to really like this tablet.  The battery life is very good and I like that this tablet is more tuned to landscape for most apps.  It has many of the new features like those of my Samsung phone.  It is pretty fast for what I use it for and video runs without an issue.  Still cannot figure out how to get my SD card in it, it won't snap in the sd holder.  But I still have plenty of storage for now.  Overall I am very pleased.  I also got the Silver book cover, which is very nice and has a nice feel to it.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Wireless and bluetooth connectivity problems all the way
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2022
text: I purchased this from different (reputable brick and mortar) store, because they had it little cheaper at that moment, but I want to leave the review here, so everybody knows how bad wireless part of this model is. First of all, wireless signal strength on this device is almost always 10db worse, than on any other device at the same location (used WiFi analyzer and also checked signal level on my access point). It tends to lose wireless connection periodically, claiming the wireless network does not have Internet connectivity (and you cannot switch this check off in modern Android). Of course, there is Internet connectivity, and no other devices in my home lose connection at the same time. Also after just a few months of use, it started disconnecting Bluetooth devices after 10-20 minutes of use, and never connects them back (and cannot discover any new devices) until fully restarted. This became absolutely frustrating to the point when it is impossible to use now.Otherwise it is an excellent tablet with great screen and sound. No use for that at all without reliable Wireless and Bluetooth though. I would not recommend this model, absolutely not!

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Disappointed in picture quality and physical side switches
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 15, 2022
text: Purchased a Galaxy Note A in 2016 and I loved it so I purchased the 2022 Note 8a as a replacement. I was very disappointed when I started to set up my new tablet.  The On/Off switch will turn the tablet On, but won't put it in sleep mode or turn it Off.  To turn the tablet Off you need to pull down a menu or go to settings, so if your tablet ever "locks up" you can't reset it by turning it off.  I guess the only way to reset the tablet would be to let the battery run out and then recharge it so you could restart the tablet.  So it would go from a simple button "push and hold" to a several hour operation.  Also there was no way to "reprogram" the start button in the settings menu.  My next issue was with the volume buttons.  The up volume button worked but the down volume button wouldn't decrease the volume.  To decrease the volume you had to push the up volume button to bring up a volume control on the screen and then quickly decrease the volume with a slide control on the screen.  With the 2018 version of the 8a you could go into settings and reprogram the volume buttons to act normally,  but that settings option was removed in the 2022 version.My next issue was with picture quality.  I like bright vivid colors and the colors looked washed out.  Easy fix, just adjust the brightness and contrast control right.  Nope, there was a brightness control, but no contrast control in the settings.  There isn't even independent controls for setting the Red, Green, and Blue scales.  There was nothing I could do to adjust the contrast and color to my satisfaction.I saw so disappointed in the overall operation of the tablet that I reset it to the original factory settings and returned it.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive

I have a tab S2 which works great so I expected the Tab A to be at least on par with an S2.Boy was i wrong.The screen is quite slow to response to touches.  Someitmes you have to 'hold' it for more than a second to register a 'tap'.The Wifi is slow, and often simply disconnects - when about 3 feet from the access point.  And then it cannot re-connect because it cannot 'authenticate'.I'm pretty much done with Samsung.  They don't support their product longer than about a year or send security updates.  Now this Tab A.  I have an ipad from 10 years ago... and guess what???  It still gets regular updates.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: I've never been so disapointed in a Samsung product as I am with this. Terrible even for "low end"
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 26, 2022
text: First, I want to say I have never been disappointed in Samsung products. until now, that is.  I upgraded from a Galaxy Tab S5e to a Galaxy Tab S8 Ultra.  The problem was, I used the Galaxy Tab S5e on a nightstand mount for a clock, some audiobooks, Kindle, music, and an alarm clock.  So, having upgraded to a huge tablet (and I love it) I needed something to fill the gap left by the smaller Galaxy Tab S5e.  I bought this Galaxy Tab A8 10.5-inch tablet.  What a mistake!Let's just dive into what's good: The price is ok and the feel of this tablet indicates a great build quality.  It'll receive up to Android 15, but I would bet it'd get even slower. That's where the "good" ends.Samsung discontinues support for tablets due to advances in technology.  The problem is, that this tablet is several steps backward in functionality and speed from older devices like the Galaxy Tab S5e.As an example, resetting the A8 for return took over 15 minutes to reset.  A typical reboot was between five and ten minutes!  The Galaxy Tab S5e was a budget "premium" tablet, so not top shelf, but definitely not the bottom.  The Galaxy Tab A8 is a bottom shelf in all but "feel".  10GB of the storage is used by the OS, which supposedly leaves 22GB for apps and data.  Even with a 512GB micro SD card, I was getting errors or running out of space and that was copied from a 32GB tablet with a 512GB micro SD to another.  Lame.At night, with a completely black screen, the light bleed was so bad it would illuminate my room to an annoying level, and that was with the brightness as low as it would go.  The color quality is atrocious. I'm the type that schedules the eye care to turn on limiting blue light, which adds a yellow tint.  This A8 turned orange.  Regardless of the strength of the blue light filter, everything that should be white (with a yellow hue) was orange.I'm at the point where I'm going to just eat the $200 trade-in for the S5e and keep it rather than keeping the A8.  I really don't think this would placate a child that has no expectations of performance; yes, it's that bad.I do not recommend this product.  Save your money and buy a Galaxy Tab S series.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: It's growing on me.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 8, 2022
text: I once heard this about Samsung, "There's Samsung and then there's everybody else." This has proven to be true. All of my past and present Android devices were from Motorola, Lenovo and Google. There was an immediate, comfortable familiarity and similarity between how those devices functioned, etc.Now I'm learning the Samsung way and it's been quite new and different. Not bad at all just different in it's style and format.Anyway, now to the A8 specifically. I am not now and never have been a power user. So, the A8 is more than adequate for my needs. After much fiddling and trial and error (the new Samsung way, remember) and countless trips to settings I tailored the A8 to my liking and it is quite nice. The stock wallpapers are lame so I imported Google wallpaper. And I installed Gboard because it's an old, trusted friend.Initially I was NOT happy with battery life/time. I have since discovered that the battery is "learning" my usage habits. etc., and it is now performing as advertised. Maybe better. There are a number of maintenance and care functions in settings. The auto sleep function of my case cover helps too.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Excellent features and price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 9, 2022
text: Given that tablets aren't supported through too many OS upgrades, to me it makes sense to buy one that balances present needs and a moderate amount of future capability against cost.  The A8 (2021) with 128GB of storage has a good screen, substantial construction, plenty of memory (which will make it usable long after the OS is obsolete) and adequate performance.  The Samsung interface built on top of Android is pretty good.  Bloatware isn't extensive.  I especially like the ability to split the screen and use 2 apps at the same time.  I also like the ability to mirror the screen and sound to a smart TV or Roku.  The only thing missing in my opinion is a touch sensor to unlock the device; logging in is such a drag and Android's (not Samsung's) Smart Lock is unreliable at times.  Sound using the built-in speakers is pleasant. Headphone sound using the wired jack is OK but not outstanding.  Can't report on Bluetooth audio.  Samsung is slow to roll out Android upgrades but they eventually do appear.  A great value in my opinion.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive

text: I didn't want to drag a laptop around. Most of my writing is done on my desktop. However I have found myself away from home a lot in the last six months. To keep up on working on my books, and articles and stories I decided to purchase a tablet.This arrived and I began setting it up.Used it today and hot spotted it off my phone as I was no where near internet and it performed perfectly for what I wanted it for.Highly impressed with the camera my phone supposedly has a much better camera but this tablets camera takes clearer and sharper video and pictures.

text: Delivered quick and packaged well.  Hubby starting to have issues reading his smart phone.  Upon receipt he did a sync with his phone.  Took a couple of hours but was easy and seamless.  This tablet also serves as his phone while in use. The quality of phone conversation is good.  It sits beside him always and he uses it constantly.  He no longer has to mirror his phone to the TV [thank you] and does all his conference calls and courses on the tablet.  It could be a little quicker but I chalk that up to the 20 devices we're already running on our gateway.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Great Budget Tablet
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 20, 2023
text: I'm rating this as a budget tablet, which means I'm not comparing it to the much more expensive S-series or other flagships. If you're looking for a tablet which will allow you to do serious work or high-end gaming, you're probably better off looking at those. However, if you're looking for something for entertainment (streaming, reading ebooks, light gaming, checking social media and e-mail) then this device is perfectly capable. It can do just about everything a mid-range phone can do.I personally went with the 128 gb/4 gb RAM. I'd recommend getting the 64 gb or 128 gb for the 4 gb RAM. The 32 gb model only has 3 gb RAM. If you expect to occasionally do some multitasking or otherwise tend to leave apps open or running in the background, that extra gig of RAM should help things run more smoothly. You can expand the storage by using a microSD card but be aware that not all apps are designed to be run that way. I'd still recommend getting enough storage for at least most of the apps you use regularly. SD storage is better used for downloads, pictures, etc.In terms of performance, this tablet can run your day-to-day tasks smoothly. I've tried a few streaming services and they've all run as fine as they do on my other devices (or at least as well as the device is designed to handle).The LCD screen isn't as impressive as some of Samsung's AMOLED screens, but the picture quality is still quite good for a budget device. It's full HD. I'm sure some people will disagree, but I personally don't think you need more than that for a 10-inch screen.If you already have Samsung devices, they can work together. I have my Tab connected with my phone. I can get messages and even calls while I'm on my tablet.I saw another review posted that said they couldn't figure out how to take screenshots. For people not familiar with Samsung devices: You press the power button and the volume down button at the same time. It'll take the shot immediately. It's a bit more awkward on the tablet than it is on my phone because of the positioning of the buttons, but I believe it works the same on all Samsung phones/tablets.Also, as of this post, it will try to update to Android 13 (Samsung One UI 5.0) right out of the box, so plan to give it some time to set up.Overall, it's just a very solid and capable budget tablet and I'm quite happy with it.

text: This tablet has a lot of storage space that apps will not take up a lot of space. I lover the 128GB tablet that does the job. 32GB and 64GB tablets don't have enough storage space and they are limited when installing the apps and uninstalling apps that have lots of storage and they don't work.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Great affordable option!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 16, 2022
text: I don't know much about tech specs, but I make an effort to research online reviews from various tech websites and YouTube reviews before buying.The good news: The general concensus is that this is a good value for an all-around affordable tablet for doing "basic stuff". Since I'm a daily "basic stuff" user (internet surfing, movies/streaming, music, social media, emails, news, etc), I really didn't want to pay more than I actually needed to.I've been using this tablet for a couple of weeks and am very happy!I purchased the 4gb/64gb and it performs smoothly opening/closing multiple apps, scrolling, video playback, internet browsing, etc. No stuttering or lag.The picture quality for movie watching & streaming is enjoyable! Smooth and clear! Some have complained that the coloring is on the cool side (VS warm side).  I agree... When I compared my old tablet to this one side by side, the cool tone does make some (not all) content appear less vivid. Again, not a deal breaker for the pricing... and certainly not bad that it distracts or ruins the viewing experience.The sound quality is crisp and clear. I love the surround sound vibe that the 4 speakers provide (2 on each side). Nice extra that they still kept the headphone jack on the this model.***Fyi... Make a note to verify Dolby Atmos setting is turned on (goto settings, sound, sound quality effects). Mine was off and I was wondering why the sound was so low at first.The battery holds the charge very well for my pattern of daily usage. Included in the box is a 7.75watt adapter that has a USB-C port... and also a USB C to USB C cable (it takes about 6hrs to get full charge when drained).The tablet is capable of up to 15 watt fast charging (about 3hrs to get a full charge when drained). You will need to purchase a 15 watt charger separately if you want "fast charging" in your future.***In settings, you have the option to turn on/off "fast charging". Make sure that option is on when you need to utilize it.The design feels nice... Slim and lightweight. Comfortable to hold in both hands. Yet also has a sturdy/supportive feel due to the metal backing. I use a case on mine, which makes all of that moot though. I also add a screen protector (which didn't affect the accuracy of the touch screen capability).I'd definitely recommend if you are looking for an all-around good/solid tablet that doesn't break the bank!I did have a serious issue at first with this tablet:There is a small minority of reviews that say the wifi drops out or gets a weak signal or a fluctuating signal. Unfortunately I did experience this. Altho it worked fine when I was in the area of my wifi router, the signal was extremely weak (buffering/slow loading) when I'd go to the far end of the house. I never had a wifi signal problem at far end of the house prior. A few said they returned the tablet, but then reported that the replacement did the same thing... So maybe this tablet doesn't play well with particular routers or has issues with interference, since only a very small minority reported the problem. What to do?Since I really liked this tablet and didn't want the hassle of finding another model or brand...I noticed a review posted by B. Maschal on September 14, 2022 who said he bought the Tab A8 and experienced same issue. He said he bought a wifi extender which solved the problem. I don't even know what a wifi extender is... Lol. So...I took a chance and purchased a random $25 wifi extender on Amazon (TP-Link AC750 WiFi Extender RE220)... and that solved the issue for me!Update 1/29/2023: have been using daily for 3 months and haven't had any issues. Also no complications when it updated to Android 13. Very happy with this tablet!

text: I bought this 64 gig 10.5 inch to use as my register on my food truck. I use my note9 as my hot spot and it works great. Very fast. Now I'm taking a real estate class and have been using it for my classes along with a mini wireless keyboard. Great tablet for the money. Nice and big. I was running it early today for a few hours and tonight for my remote class for over 4 hours and the screen was on the whole time and turned up all the way on the brightness lever. Still had over 30% battery life left. Screen is bright and clear. Glad I got it when it was for $210. The price has gone up. I'm an android guy and this tablet reinforced my love for Samsung gear.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: Worth the wait
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2023
text: I bought two of these tablets for my parents for Christmas in hopes it would arrive on time. It didn't, but that's ok now. The protective cases that I ordered separately to go with these tablets had arrived so I wrapped those up and printed a screenshot of the order so they would know what they were going to get. My elderly parents were using cheap $40 or cheaper no name brand tablets for years and then wonder why they can't play the things they want on them or why they didn't last. They absolutely love these tablets.  I did have to help my parents set the tablets up, I'm sure they would have figured it out on their own as it's pretty straight forward and simple, but they have no patience and refused to do it. It does have Smartswitch to help transfer files and apps from the old tablet, but if the old tablets are outdated, such as theirs, it's not an option unless you want to pay for another knockoff smartswitch app from the Google play store to do that, I refused to pay for something I wasn't sure was going to work lol. So I downloaded all their apps manually, which was very fast. The display is amazing, the size is perfect for my parents.  Now they've only had this a few days now, but they've had no issues which for my parents is a miracle in itself lol. They watch videos and play tons of fb games with no lagging issues or technical issues. They are so happy with these tablets  Now waiting for this to be shipped was agonizingly slow in this day and age and the delivery date was even pushed back some after I had ordered which almost made me reconsider requesting a refund, but once it does actually ship it's very fast. Very happy with purchase

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: An improvement over my old Tab E.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 25, 2022
text: I bought this to replace my old Tab E, which I still use, but more or less keep it always plugged in and use it as an alarm clock. So I needed a new tablet. No one in town had one with a 10.5 inch scree. But Amazon did, so I bought the A8. Now I had requirements. It had to have a SD card slot, so many do not have them. Also, it does not have alot of Bloatware on it, what it did have I was able to remove. Screen is nice and bright, and adjustable for brightness. Battery could be better, longer lasting, but I have a USB Power Bank I can plug into it and power for days. There are reviews of this that its not perfect that its low end and budget friendly, and maybe it is, but I like it and use it. For a week in August I used it every day when I was manning a booth at the local county fair. Not only did I watch lots of video's, but did my YouTubing, and I had no issues, except the on screen keyboard, but I am legally blind. So I will bet a Bluetooth keyboard for it. Over all, a good tablet, and worth the money.

text: I purchased this tablet to use with my DJI Mini 2 drone. I'd tried several other tablets, including several iPads. None of which was actually compatible. This tablet, works perfectly with my drones, and I love the size of the display. I also use to to watch Amazon Prime  and Netflix videos. The image and sound quality is impressive. App response time is very fast. It comes prepackaged with a bit of bloatware (pre-installed applications). The extra applications were easily removed, which freed up some storage space. You can also add a SD chip for additional storage. . I can honestly say that I recommend this product and that you will be happy with the purchase. I don't have anything negative what so ever to say about it.

title: This has made me more productive!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 8, 2022
text: I have a few gadgets so I didn't think I really need a Galaxy Tab A8 with 64GB. I bought one anyway. And turns out, I use it to entertain myself while doing mindless chores (folding clothes, washing dishes, etc.). With YouTube videos or other entertainment playing in the background, I tend to get more work done more quickly now. And after work, it's a relaxing way to unwind (I get home at 11pm most nights). Still trying to find the best cover/stand combination (I like the one I have for my Kindle Fire 10+, but I ain't finded one for the Tab yet). Despite the cover/stand issues, I am pleasantly surprised at how satisfied I am with this spur-of-the-moment purchase.

title: This Andoid tablet is a great value with all the features I need and more.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2022
text: After limping along with an obsolete tablet I sprang for this Samsung Galaxy Tab A8. I have no regrets.Every feature works well and I am very pleased with the display and the overall speed and responsiveness of the unit. It has awesome audio and features a 3.5mm headphone output to accommodate a broader choice of headsets, headphones, or earbuds.The tablet came loaded with Android 11 and it immediately upgraded to Android 12.I highly recommend buying the 128 GB model. Samsung includes about 30 gigs of bloatware and, if you aim low on native storage (32 GB) you will seriously regret it.I have only had this tablet a short time but I can't see any downside to it and I am thoroughly enjoying it.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A8 10.5‚Äù 32GB Android Tablet w/ LCD Screen, Long Lasting Battery, Kids Content, Smart Switch, Expandable Memory, US Version, Silver, Amazon Exclusive
title: 10 Years and WOW!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 23, 2022
text: As the headline reads, it has been 10 years since I first got a tablet.  It was a gift, so I couldn't choose.  An Apple ipad2.  In 10 years' time, I managed to continue using it (WIFI only) with compounding levels of frustration.  When Apple ceased use of the @me.com email server and the Apple rep told me (at year 5) that I needed to buy a new iPad because my old one was "obsolete," I vowed never to buy into the hype that is Apple, never.  Surprisingly, a year ago, the @me.com email server started working again.  So much for the "genius" being so smart.  Comparing the A8 to a 10-year-old ipad is probably unfair, but when you consider the entry level price VS that of a new ipad,  I am convinced of Apple's false sense of superiority.  I did consider purchasing a Tab S8, but when I got right down to it, I am not streaming movies or performing amazing feats of graphic design on a tablet, EVER! So why do I need it?  Truth told, the A8 will stream, but that is not my purpose for it. I use it to read the morning paper or quickly check email when I don't want to walk to the home office on the other side of the house or to share content on FB with a guest.  Considering the short term support these devices offer, why should I spend 5, 6 or 700 dollars to do the simple tasks the A8 handles with ease.  I am totally happy with my purchase of the A8 and suggest it is indeed a sound replacement to an aged tablet.
